action.action-desc: Mr. Carter of Georgia (for himself and Ms. Titus) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Better Utilization of Investments Leading to Development Act of 2018 to provide support in high-income economy countries for projects involving development or processing of certain critical materials.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Critical Mineral Access Act.

section.header: Amendments to Better Utilization of Investments Leading to Development Act of 2018
section.text: Section 1412(b) of the Better Utilization of Investments Leading to Development Act of 2018 (22 U.S.C. 9612(b)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking The purpose and inserting the following:
by striking shall be to and inserting the following:
by striking the United States. and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: to provide support under title II in high-income economy countries for projects involving development or processing of covered critical materials if such support furthers the national security interests of the United States.

paragraph.text: by striking In carrying out and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: The term covered critical materials means aluminum (bauxite), antimony, arsenic, barite, beryllium, bismuth, cesium, chromium, cobalt, fluorspar, gallium, germanium, graphite (natural), hafnium, helium, indium, lithium, magnesium, manganese, niobium, platinum group metals, potash, the rare earth elements group, rhenium, rubidium, scandium, strontium, tantalum, tellurium, tin, titanium, tungsten, uranium, vanadium, and zirconium.

In clause (i), the term rare earth elements group means lanthanum, cerium, praseodymium, neodymium, promethium, samarium, europium, gadolinium, terbium, dysprosium, holmium, erbium, thulium, ytterbium, lutetium, scandium, yttrium.

subparagraph.text: The term high-income economy country means a country with a high-income economy, as defined by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the International Development Association (collectively referred to as the World Bank).
